11.details: 1. Create comprehensive benchmarking framework comparing MultiOS to existing systems. 2. Implement detailed memory profiling and optimization tools. 3. Optimize boot process targeting sub-2-second boot times. 4. Profile and tune all 4 scheduling algorithms with real workloads. 5. Create performance monitoring dashboard showing system metrics in real-time.

12.details: 1. Setup automated CI/CD pipeline with testing across x86_64, ARM64, RISC-V. 2. Create real hardware testing framework (older PCs, Raspberry Pi, etc.). 3. Develop comprehensive stress testing for memory management and file systems. 4. Build automated regression testing suite. 5. Create test case generation framework for edge cases.

13.details: 1. Create interactive step-by-step debugging sessions in UI. 2. Build interactive code browser with real-time explanations. 3. Implement kernel internals visualization (memory maps, process trees). 4. Create performance visualization tools showing real-time system behavior. 5. Build educational game mechanics for learning OS concepts.

14.details: 1. Implement lightweight container support for educational isolation. 2. Build complete TCP/IP network stack with socket programming. 3. Create distributed computing framework for parallel processing education. 4. Add machine learning workloads for CS education. 5. Implement hypervisor capabilities for nested OS experiments.

15.details: 1. Develop direct hardware boot capability (replace QEMU dependency). 2. Implement comprehensive USB device driver framework. 3. Complete audio subsystem for multimedia education. 4. Add Wi-Fi and networking drivers. 5. Create support for modern input devices (touch, gesture, voice).

Build contribution guidelines and coding standards. 4. Create developer portal with online code editor. 5. Build package manager for educational software. 6. Create app store for curated educational applications.

Create scientific computing workloads for education. 5. Build database systems for CS curriculum. 6. Create version control system for teaching collaboration.
